articles.content: Professor Yves Cohen from the Avicenne Hospital in Bobigny said in an interview with local media that it appears that Covid-19 was already in France at the end of 2019 – rather than in January-February 2020 – as had previously been thought. A decision was mad… [+1016 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus: Non-COVID patient care 'on hold' as doctors fear wave of referrals after lockdown - The Loppy
articles.description:
Sky


NHS cancer surgeons are out of work as referrals have dropped by 75% - as doctors warned non-coronavirus patients may have died because they have been "neglected".

With 25% of NHS doctors redeployed to care for COVID-19 patients, thousands of medi…

articles.title: Coronavirus: Scientists baffled by unusual COVID-19 effect dubbed 'happy hypoxia' - Mirror Online
articles.description: The phenomenon, which doctors are calling ‘happy hypoxia’, raises questions about how coronavirus attacks the lungs
articles.content:
From a fever to a dry cough, coronavirus is known to be associated with a range of unpleasant symptoms. 
Now, doctors have revealed that theyve also seen several patients with worryingly low oxygen levels, despite the fact that they seem completely healthy.… [+1608 chars]
